Hi Daniel & Sam


First off, thank you for considering Trip by Numbers for this project. With over 10 years experience in system design and process improvement, I excel at understanding, translating and operationalising complex business processes through the use of innovative technology systems.

I have been working exclusively on the Salesforce platform for over 4 years and my passion for what it can do and how it enables businesses continues to grow.

Myself and my offshore team have immense skills and capabilities in delivering and implementing Salesforce to support businesses in their digital transformation. By leveraging the global workforce to deliver the technical aspects of the project whilst I provide dedicated onshore support and guidance, we can deliver a user-friendly and technically proficient solution whilst keeping costs manageable.

I look forward to working closely with you and your team in Melbourne

Kind Regards,

Charlotte Hailey

Services


All project management services are included for any required additional development team members. Task deadline management for internal Adapt staff members is included for any additional required inputs such as design assets, decisions, contract execution etc.


1. Research


The outputs from this phase will be:

  • A full list of user stories with priority rankings based on importance, effort and cost
  • A full understanding of the existing security and sharing models set up in Adapt's production Org
  • Identification of sandbox environment for development

    • 2. Design


    The outputs from this phase will be:

  • Full Solution Design including wireframes and any required customer journey mapping
  • Scope and analysis of third party applications required to extend functionality to desired level
  • Breakdown of additional licensing costs for third party applications
  • Internal user access defined
  • Development strategy, timelines, defined sprints and any required team members

    • 3. Develop

    4. Test

    5. Train

    6. Deploy


    The outputs from these phases will be:

  • Continued development and resolution of user stories through Agile sprints
  • Implementation and configuration of third party applications
  • Testing on all functionality, security and sharing
  • Browser and device testing
  • System configuration documentation
  • Internal user training sessions on delivered functionality
  • One month post go-live support


    • Not Included

  • Configuration of Service Cloud features such as Case Management and Live Agent (Lightning or Classic Knowledge configurations is included)
  • Creation of highly customised templates from scratch*
  • Creation of internal training manuals
  • Changes to scope not agreed to in writing
  • Custom Lightning component development not agreed to in writing

    • *Whilst ample customisations are avaliable, excessive use of CSS styling can be detrimental to a maintainable community as with each package update release, CSS code will need to be reviewed, revised and re-written prior to new features becoming available.

    Timeframe

    2018
    1 Dec

    If accepted, project can commence on this date. Commencement will include the sharing of pre-defined user stories, high level wireframes and a 1 to 2 hour session with the Adapt Product Owner to refine and define user stories. Additionally, full admin access will be required to either a recent Full Copy Production Sandbox or to the Production Org to perform the review and analysis on the existing system config.

    15 Dec

    Design phase will be completed and the development plan will be finalised. Once sign off is given, development sprints will commence.

    2019
    7 Jan

    The majority of development expected to be completed by this date. Depending on the availability of Adapt staff, development sprints can continue throughout the holiday period whilst testing and deployment can be delayed until final sign off is given.

    21 Jan

    Target go-live date

    Budget



    Payments will be broken down into three instalments in line with the delivery of each phase of the project. Full payment terms will be included in the Service Agreement.

    Service Quote
    Research $2,000
    Design $3,000
    Develop, Test, Train, Deploy $5,500

    Team and Engagement


    Charlotte Hailey


    I will play a central role in owning and achieving on-time delivery of the project. I will be very hands on throughout the project, interacting with the Adapt Product Owner and liaising with your Salesforce Account Executive to ensure access to features and licenses is granted as required. I will also play a central role in negotiating and liaising with any third party developers or applications teams for any third party integrations that are required. In the small chance that custom APEX or Lightning development is required that is beyond my technical skill set, I will engage my team of off-shore Salesforce Partner Developers.



    Adapt Product Owner


    This person will be an Adapt employee and the deciding voice in the direction of the Community Development. Decisions such as feature prioritisation, third party application costs, changes to scope, internal user access, sharing models and security will be made by this person. They may delegate responsibility internally for specific decisons, by doing so in writing. An example of this would be delegating the choice of colours, banner images and other design aspects to the internal marketing person. This would not include delegating any decisions of a material nature to subordinates, such as decisions surrounding key functionality.
